results.title: Product Manager
results.description:
ABOUT THE COMPANY
Bonfire is transforming the way people buy and sell high-quality custom apparel. We are a free online platform where anyone can design, sell, and buy custom products. We’ve helped thousands of individuals, groups, and nonprofits raise money for the causes they care about, and also serve the world’s top creators as their premiere custom merch platform. We’re a passionate, creative, and data-driven team constantly pursuing our vision: to strengthen communities that inspire a kinder world. We bring this vision to life by hiring passionate, smart people who celebrate and respect others, are committed to a life of curiosity, are never satisfied with ‘good enough’, are eager to co-create the future, and who thrive through teamwork. Have we been looking for you?

ABOUT THE JOB

Our Product team is searching for their future Product Manager. The ideal candidate will value critical thinking and intellectual honesty, and have an insatiable need to continuously improve oneself to learn and navigate new and changing technologies and market opportunities. 

Our Product Managers at Bonfire are “full stack” PMs. You will work closely with our engineering team, designers, and senior management to design solutions, in addition to participating in customer interactions to define needs, test out options, and get feedback for the features you release. You will ensure alignment with our Growth team: Customer Support, Marketing, and Sales.

In this role you will make decisions by being data-informed at all times and data-driven where appropriate. While using design thinking to bring our customers the best experience, it is also essential to communicate and collaborate with the Engineering team to create solutions to problems we want to solve, all while delivering high quality service to our customers and their markets. 

This role lies within our Product department and reports to the Director of Product. 

____________________

Bonfire employees are expected to embrace the Mission and Values, we live together and apart:  Humble Ingenuity, Trusting Partnerships, Inclusive Cooperation, Moral Courage, Healthy Dissatisfaction

Bonfire is currently supporting a virtual work environment; however, we are looking to only hire candidates who reside in the following locations: ​​North Carolina, Virginia, Washington DC, Maryland, and Pennsylvania.

____________________

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES 

include but are not limited to:

  1. Interview customers to understand needs. Deeply understand our customers’ workflows and jobs-to-be-done.
  2. Define product requirements, communicate the “why” to engineers and executives alike.
  3. Meet and collaborate with stakeholders to source/validate/evolve features and the roadmap.
  4. Own and manage the backlog and roadmap for your area of responsibility. Prioritize between new features, architectural improvements, and operational excellence.
  5. Interact daily with the engineering and design teams in both the design and development phases by running the agile meetings.
  6. Create initial low-fi wireframes and coordinate hi-fi mockups with the product design team.
  7. Manage stakeholder expectations and communication for upcoming/planned releases.
  8. Contribute to the educational content of improvements and features to ensure smooth adjustment to stakeholder processes.
  9. Analyze and/or work with the Business Intelligence/Marketing teams to analyze the impact of platform changes & trends to inform future iterations.
 
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
  • Have 2+ years experience in product management.
  • Have 2+ years working within an agile software development framework.
  • Have 2+ years experience in ecommerce, saas, or a related industry.
  • Have experience working with datasets to analyze/answer business questions and/or build business cases.
  • Proficient in SQL and able to write basic to moderate queries.
  • Experience using analytics tools to explore trends in product feature usage & measure impact.
  • Experience using wireframing tools to create wireframes/prototypes/mockups for digital products.
 
ADDITIONAL DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS
  • Knowledge of and ideally experience managing roadmaps for web apps built using javascript frameworks such as Angular, React, Vue, etc.
  • Some actual coding experience is a plus, but not required.

 

WHY WORK AT BONFIRE? 

When team members all around the world were asked to find three words they’d use to describe Bonfire, the most commonly shared values were: kind, inclusive, charitable, supportive, collaborative, and passionate. Work here and help us guide people toward their full potential and possibility in support of a company that’s trying to infuse the world with more of those values. 

In addition to leading purposeful work, you will also benefit from our full-time employee offerings:  

  • Competitive compensation with great insurance and savings benefits
  • Remote work environment (We are a fully distributed team!)
  • Tech setup right-fit for your remote work environment 
  • Year-round swag giveaways
  • Unlimited PTO that we encourage everyone to take advantage of
  • A positive culture and dynamic team environment
  • The ability to help create a kinder planet
  • An environment to grow your skills, learn new technologies, and to challenge yourself 

Does this sound like you? If so, we’d love to hear from you!

results.title: People Process Manager
results.description:
Company Description

Hello, we're UW 

We’re a bunch of great people working together, solving problems and having fun. Together, we strive to find solutions to help the great people around us get on with the things that matter in life.

How? It’s simple, we take the headache out of essential home services by providing them n one place – energy, broadband, mobile, and even insurance.  That’s one provider, one account, one bill, and lots of savings.

We’re a truly unique FTSE 250 company with a business model that has a aneal social impact at the heart of it. Being a part of the UW community you’ll join a working environment like no other - one where everyone matters - be it our customers, our partners or you, our people.

About the role 

Due to our business growth, we are looking for a new People (HR) Process Manager to join our People Team. 

The role will maintain and improve the processes for employees, outsourced contractors and international workers. You will be responsible for auditing, reviewing, monitoring and setting up processes in the People department. You will liaise with other people and business departments to enhance and improve the efficiency and delivery of services. 

The successful candidate will also be part of a broader the wider People Team and will have the opportunity to be part of the regular weekly and monthly meetings and socials. 

What you'll do 

  • Create, develop and audit efficient processes for onboarding, induction, employment changes and offboarding across diverse working populations, employees, contractors, outsourced workers and international workers. Working with stakeholders across the business who need to contribute towards these processes, or require an output, to ensure they understand their responsibilities through the processes and that their needs are being met.
  • Create, maintain and audit efficient processes for reward, helping with salary banding and benchmarking data collection;
  • Create, maintain and audit efficient processes for talent review and recognition processes;
  • Create, maintain and audit efficient processes for absence management;
  • Create and maintain process documentation for audit and monitoring purposes, providing feedback to the appropriate people and teams on their consistencinof following the processes;
  • Help maintain records and data and perform quality checks for people systems and associated processes;
  • Build strong relationships with those teams responsible for delivering the processes (including People Operations, Recruitment, EUX, Facilities, etc.) to ensure they are kept up to date with any changes and provide feedback on how their teams are delivering against them.

About you

  • A background in HR/People Operations and experience with building operational HR/People processes;
  • A good understanding of HR/People processes and the roles and responsibilities that different teams have in delivering them; 
  • Great at problem-solving - not afraid to think outside the box to get a solution that works for UW;
  • Experience in a fast-paced, scale-up environment;
  • Strong analytical skills with an eye for detail;
  • Comfortable with using HRIS and/or Payroll Systems;
  • Experience in using Google Suite and/or Excel to manipulate and analyse data;
  • A willingness and genuine interest in learning;
  • Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal), with a friendly and approachable attitude, and strong teamwork skills;
  • Excellent organisational, and time management skills and ability to prioritise own workload;
  • Ability to perform tasks under pressure and balance many tasks simultaneously;
  • Motivation to get stuck in with new projects;
  • Flexibility and adaptability – the responsibilities and priorities for this role may changeregularlys!

 

What's it in for you?

Join a high-growth FTSE 250 business and help us achieve our ambitions whilst learning and having fun. Become part of a fantastic business culture where people are at the heart of everything we do.

 

  • Huge opportunities for exposure & development as we scale up
  • A competitive salary 
  • 25 days holiday plus Bank Holidays
  • Life Insurance up to 4 x your salary
  • Discounted healthcare and medical cash plans including a free Virtual GP service
  • Private pension scheme
  • Share options and Save As You Earn Scheme
  • A range of Health & well-being benefits including a confidential Employee Assistance Programme, Virtual fitness classes and wellness tools
  • Discounts on UW products & services 

 

Apply here!  

 

If you think this is the role for you and want to be part of UW’s extraordinary growth, apply now. 



Job Description



Qualifications



Additional Information
 

We provide equal opportunities, a diverse and inclusive work environment, and fairness for everyone. You are welcome to apply no matter your age, disability, gender, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity status, race, religion or belief, or sexual orientation.

results.title: Web3 People Operations Coordinator
results.description:
We are ClubRare - The World's first community-centered Physical NFT marketplace for collectors. We connect the Real-world and the Metaverse. We are a community for people who trade the things we love.

We are a fully remote company with no fixed headquarters. As a distributed company, we embrace a diverse and inclusive culture that transcends geographical borders. Our team members come from all over the world and bring a rich array of experiences, perspectives, and lifestyles to the team. We believe that this diversity enhances our creativity, collaboration, and innovation, and enables us to deliver outstanding products and services to our customers.

We are deeply committed to fostering a culture of empathy, integrity, strategic thinking, innovation, leadership, and performance. These values drive everything we do, from the way we interact with our customers and partners, to the way we develop and deliver our products and services. It's our shared values that give us the strength and drive to become the open metaverse for collectors.

What’s in It for You?

  • Be a vital member of a cutting-edge project and take your career to the next level.
  • Work from anywhere, on your own schedule, and be part of a team that shares your values and has a clear vision.
  • Have the chance to shape the future of an innovative new model for cryptocurrency and blockchain applications.
  • Get hands-on experience with the latest tech and systems, and challenge yourself to learn and grow.
  • Play an active role in one of the most significant technological innovations in human history.
  • Be compensated with a competitive salary paid in crypto for your dedication and efforts.

Your Impact

In this role, you will have the opportunity to get involved in all aspects of People Operations and will play a crucial role in supporting the growth and development of the organization.

The ideal candidate will have excellent communication skills, a proactive and hands-on approach, attention to detail, and a passion for learning about and staying up-to-date on the latest trends in Web3 and NFTs. This is a part-time role with the potential to transition to a full-time position in the future. If you are a motivated and organized individual with a keen interest in the intersection of technology and HR, this could be the perfect opportunity for you.

As a People Operations Coordinator, your responsibilities will include:

  • Designing and implementing processes such as onboarding, employee and manager feedback cycles, recruiting, and interviewing.
  • Developing and continuously improving HR policies and processes, including tools/systems and operational guides.
  • Taking ownership of employee queries and using critical thinking to identify and resolve root causes.
  • Documenting and maintaining process procedures for the People Operations team and creating self-service resources for all employees.
  • Managing semi-monthly and monthly payrolls accurately and efficiently.
  • Working with a high level of autonomy and cross-functionally to ensure all employees have the support and resources they need to succeed.

Requirements

  • 3+ years of experience in People Operations, with a track record of success in supporting and scaling HR and Recruiting functions and processes.
  • A demonstrated passion for staying at the forefront of technology and innovation, with a minimum of 1 year of experience in a Web3 or start-up company.
  • Excellent English language skills, both written and verbal.
  • Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build relationships with employees at all levels of the organization.
  • A proactive, "can-do" attitude and a willingness to take on new challenges.
  • Experience working with high-performing teams and a track record of contributing to team success.
  • A tech-savvy mindset and attention to detail, with the ability to navigate and adapt to new systems and tools.
  • The ability to handle sensitive and critical information, conversations, and situations with compassion and discretion.

Discover more about ClubRare and what we stand for by visiting our website at www.clubrare.xyz


We are committed to creating a work environment that is inclusive and welcoming to all. As an equal-opportunity employer, we do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or any other characteristic. We believe that diversity is a source of strength and all qualified candidates will be given equal consideration for employment at ClubRare.

results.title: Application Security Engineer
results.description:
Are you ready for a new way of working? Automox is launching organizations into the future with cloud-native IT operations. By ditching clunky legacy tools and automating soul-crushing manual tasks, IT admins can get back to more exciting, strategic work. Behind our effortlessly modern platform is a group of builders, innovators, and entrepreneurial thinkers breaking the status quo–and having a lot of fun doing it. Our award winning culture, values, and community are shaped by real people doing really extraordinary work. 
 
Ditch your daily commute, say goodbye to the typical nine-to-five, and embrace a new way of working at Automox.
 
OVERVIEW 
 
As the Application Security Engineer at Automox, you’ll play a mission-critical role in supporting secure architecture and review, bug bounty, our Secure Software Development Framework(SSDF) adoption, as well as security control implementation. Your role reports directly to the Manager, Security Ops and you’ll work cross-functionally with other stakeholders in DevOps, ITOps, and Engineering.



WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING
  • Maturing our Security Development Lifecycle(SDL) using the Secure Software Development Framework(SSDF) as the north star.
  • Provide security expertise to developers during code reviews, design reviews, and vulnerability triage.
  • Research new and novel ways to accomplish application security work and publish your findings on our blog.
  • Participate in a monthly security on-call rotation for critical escalations. 
  • Build security capabilities utilizing the attacker mindset and other adversary research.
 



SHARED VALUES
  • Customer Focused - You advocate for our internal and external customers with empathy and have a deep understanding of their needs.
  • Nimble - You seek out and embrace opportunities and other points of view.
  • Tenacious - You are willing to go first and fail without ego.



WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE
  • You have 2+ years of experience in application security and exposure to SaaS companies.
  • You have experience automating tasks in a programming language of your choice (python, go, nodejs, etc.).
  • You can triage security issues appropriately; accounting for reachability and business impact.
  • You have experience participating in a security program at a mid-stage startup where everything requires compromise.
  • You enjoy having philosophical discussions about security practices and ways to improve them.
  • You want a chance to try something new without much bureaucratic overhead.
COMPENSATION
Colorado applicants: The midpoint annual salary for this role is $140,000. Base pay is part of a rich total compensation package and is included for demonstrative purposes only.
 
ABOUT AUTOMOX
Automox is the cloud-native IT operations platform for modern organizations. Our award-winning answer to modern IT operations and best-in-class results earned Automox four straight quarters of record growth. We are now trusted by more than 2,500 leading companies and MSPs worldwide, including NASA, Yale, Xerox, Allbirds, and Unicef. It makes it easy to keep every endpoint automatically configured, patched, and secured – anywhere in the world. The future of IT Operations is cloud-native – and right now. Will you join us?
 
TOTAL REWARDS: Thrive with Us
Beyond the Status Quo
🇺🇸 Work from anywhere in the USA
💵Competitive Salary
📈Equity for Full-Time Employees
🏝Flexible PTO, generous sick time policy
👋🏽$20 a month to connect virtually with colleagues
⏱Active Giving committee and employee-led communities 
 
Health & Wellness

🩺 Company HSA Contribution: $100-$150-$200 per month based on tier
🩺 Gender Affirmation Coverage on Cigna Medical Plan (including surgery)
 
Happiness & Well-Being

👨‍👧‍👦 $10k Adoption Benefit

LOCATION
We are a fully distributed company and have remote workers throughout the United States, and some parts of Canada.
 
We are committed to an inclusive and diverse company. Automox is an equal opportunity employer. results.title: Business Analyst II
results.description:
Business Analyst II

Are you the one we’re looking for?
Diverse Computing, Inc. is seeking highly motivated entry- to mid-level technical Business Analysts to join our team. This is an immediate opening, and it will be available to candidates seeking remote or hybrid (office/remote) working opportunities. This Business Analyst will be responsible for leading and executing complex business analysis activities. The focus of this position is to work closely with our criminal justice and public safety clients to fully understand their business processes and translate information into clear system requirements for the project team. Please note that this is NOT a data analyst type of position. Rather, this role requires the ability to understand complex technical and business processes, demonstrate excellent problem-solving skills, and provide outstanding customer service. Responsibilities will also include interfacing with management to achieve project goals and objectives while supporting other members of the project team. We believe our project teams should be one step ahead, proactively asking questions and acting in the interest of the client as well as the company's success.

Get to know us a little.

At Diverse Computing, we are passionate about making a difference. Our mission: Deliver innovative solutions that improve the effectiveness and security of the public safety community. In other words, we create software that has a higher purpose than simply making a profit. Imagine working for a company where you can take ownership of your projects, be an integral part of team-oriented innovation, and play a pivotal role with software that is designed to improve public safety. At Diverse Computing, these aren't just catch phrases... they are part of our everyday reality, and yes, we're proud of it!



As a Business Analyst II, you will:

  • Assume leadership responsibilities as assigned by the project leader
  • Achieve project goals and objectives through project management team coordination
  • Engage in and produce quality analytical work and deliverables, including:
    - Facilitating needs assessment and investigative gathering of business requirements from project stakeholders
    - Strategic planning; risk identification and developing mitigation strategies
    - Preparing for and leading status meetings
    - Eliciting systems requirements and utilizing requirements matrices
    - Defining elements of system design
    - Developing process models, diagrams, BPMN, and mockups
    - Tracking project tasks and action items
    - Creating status reports
    - Scheduling updates
    - Creating test plans and scripts
  • Be responsible for learning DCI’s products, how to troubleshoot issues, interpret logs, and correct issues within those products
  • Perform quality assurance testing for Diverse Computing products, including system testing, reporting issues, coordinating with technical resources, and confirming that software issues are resolved prior to delivery to the client
  • Be committed to expanding your technical skills, including XML and XSLT
  • Support DCI customers through hosting DCI product system training sessions and workshops, both in-person and in online settings
  • Assist in the Agile/Scrum development process, including:
    - Decomposing IT concepts into Scrum user stories with detailed acceptance criteria and mockups as necessary
    - Assisting in managing and prioritizing product backlog
    - Participating in Agile sprints, performing testing to ensure acceptance criteria are met

Success factors generally include a/an:

  • Strong Type A personality
  • High degree of pride in accuracy, attention to detail, organization, confidentiality, and humble confidence
  • Analytical mindset with excellent problem-solving skills
  • Satisfaction and enjoyment derived from detailed planning and time management
  • Natural talent for leadership and professionalism
  • Talent for tactfully and effectively communicating both positive and constructive feedback
  • Ability to truly listen when communicating with others and reflectively responding to needs
  • Proactive approach to strategic planning
  • High level of comfort when leading meetings and presenting to a group
  • Dedication to teamwork, and cooperation
  • High regard for taking responsibility and ownership of one’s own work and actions
  • Strong work ethic and internal drive to accurately and effectively meeting deadlines
  • Knack for thriving in a fast-paced environment and demonstrating responsible decisiveness
  • Affinity for service-oriented helpfulness
  • Talent for productive and solution-oriented conflict resolution
  • Personal passion for, or interest in, supporting criminal justice and law enforcement agencies
  • Desire to lead by example through living the DCI core values of integrity, passion, customer service, innovation, and engagement

Requirements

This job might be for you, if you:

  • Have a minimum of a Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Information Communication Technology, Management Information Systems, Computer Science, or a similar degree program (related work experience may be substituted for educational requirement)
  • Have 3-5 yrs of professional experience
  • Have a strong understanding of information technology, database, and software development concepts
  • Have excellent verbal, non-verbal, and written communication skills
  • Have experience planning and facilitating project meetings
  • Have experience leading, coaching, and mentoring less experienced business analysts
  • Have experience working with technical team members to provide direction and clarification as needed
  • Have experience providing management-level reporting on project work
  • Are knowledgeable with Agile / Scrum
  • Have some experience with Linux/Unix, Windows, and data networks (this is desirable but not required)
  • Have knowledge of the public safety or criminal justice industry (this is desirable but not required)
  • Currently reside in one of these states: CO, CT, FL, IL, MA, NC, NJ, NY, SC, SD, TN, TX, UT
  • Can confidently pass rigorous fingerprint-based state and federal background screenings, as required by the nationwide agencies we work with (mandatory)
  • Do not require sponsorship to work in the U.S.; sponsorship is not available for this position
  • Are comfortable working remotely both autonomously and within a team

Benefits

Here at Diverse Computing, we understand that highly satisfied employees are key to achieving not only our goals, but the goals of our employees.
This is why we offer:

  • Competitive salary (dependent on level of experience)
  • 100% coverage of monthly health care insurance premiums for yourself or 60% discount on dependent plan premiums
  • 100% coverage of monthly life, dental, & vision insurance premiums for yourself
  • Flexible Spending Account (FSA) for health-related expenses
  • Supplemental insurance options: life, AD&D, short & long term disability coverage
  • Up to 3% matching retirement contributions
  • 15 days of annually earned PTO
  • Paid sick leave
  • 9 paid holidays annually
  • Flex Scheduling, including fully remote & hybrid (office/remote) work opportunities
  • Reimbursement of approved business-related travel & professional development expenses
  • Last, but not least, loving your job! An award-winning company culture that’s welcoming, fun, collaborative, & supportive. Find out more at https://www.diversecomputing.com

 

Ready to apply?

    • Click on the link below to start the application process
    • Provide a current resume as either a PDF or MS Word document
    • Include a cover letter that contains contact information for three (3) professional references
    • Keep an eye on your email and its spam folder since that will be our primary method of communication

We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity; it's in our name! We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, or gender identity), national origin, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or genetic information (including family medical history).

results.title: Business Development Representative
results.description:
Interplay Learning sits at the intersection of EdTech, Virtual Reality, and Enterprise Software as it modernizes Learning Management & Content Systems throughout the skilled trade industries.

Since 2016, Austin-based Interplay Learning has been building better training, better careers and better lives for its customers and their employees.

Our award-winning online and VR training for the essential skilled trades, including HVAC, Plumbing, Electrical, Solar, Multi-Family Maintenance and Facilities Maintenance workforces, is scalable and more effective than traditional training methods. By leveraging immersive learning technology, Interplay’s customers are able to train and practice hands-on learning from a desktop, phone, tablet, or in virtual reality. The result is a highly trained employee who is job-ready in weeks, not years. 

Our digital experiential learning platform, SkillMill, conveniently turns any space into a training lab with its short video courses, 3D simulations, knowledge checks, coaching, community, and connectivity.

Recent accolades include recognition by Fast Company’s World Changing Ideas Awards in the Education, General Excellence, and On the Rise categories as well as the Built-In Best Places to Work in Austin award.

 

Awards & Recognition:

  • Backed by best-in-class VC’s, we are positioned for exciting growth
  • Built-In, 50 Best Small Companies to Work For In Austin 2022
  • Prestigious 2020 Innovation Award for SkillMill, our software platform
  • Best in Business gold medal from Inc. Magazine in 2020
  • Recognized by the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation for our contribution to accelerating education innovation on our proprietary VOLT engine
  • Virtual Reality is the next “Smartphone,” VR breakthrough has begun at the enterprise level

Position: Business Development Representative (BDR)

Grow your career while making a difference! 

This is an opportunity to earn your stripes first as an Inbound Business Development Representative (BDR). From there, ample opportunity exists for a career path to the Sr Enterprise Account Executive position. Grow with us!

What you will sell:  Help prepare the next generation of skilled workers with SkillMill™, the world's leading Trades training platform. Digital training simulations and VR develop on-the-job skills quickly and efficiently, preparing learners for better careers and better lives in these essential occupations.

We are based in Austin, TX but open to 100% remote candidates (work from home, WFH, virtual sales position)

Why this position:

  • Mission-driven company with a meaningful product you can feel good about 
  • Cutting-edge technology and unique product offering 
  • Opportunity to make an impact with a clear path for growth
  • Company committed to professional development - training and coaching provided 
  • Supportive and collaborative culture
  • Competitive base salary + commission 

What you’ll do:

  • Call hot, warm, lukewarm and ice-cold leads using several resources and freedom to reach out for more
  • Set sales meetings and discovery calls at enterprise targets
  • Make strategic phone calls, write/send emails and identify leads
  • Have informative and productive conversations with high-quality prospects
  • Participate in special projects and assignments

Who you are:

  • Interest and experience in phone and email prospecting
  • Build rapport quickly through asking great questions and active listening
  • Ability to initiate a conversation, communicate value and handle objections
  • Smart and engaging email copywriter
  • Self-motivated, driven to succeed

 

Requirements:

  • 1+ year business development or sales experience
  • SaaS sales experience is a plus but not required!
  • We will ask you to record a one-way video interview if your application looks like a potential match. 

 

Don’t meet every single requirement? If you are interested in us, passionate about your work and think you would add value in this role, we encourage you to still apply.  We'd love to consider you. 

Interplay Learning Ethos:

At Interplay, we love what we do. We embrace our daily challenge to push technological limits to invent better ways to make learning easier and training more powerful. We attract passionate people and invite spirited discourse. We celebrate that our jobs fit our lives, not the inverse. We are uncompromising in our belief that together: we can build better training, build better careers and build better lives for customers and our team.

 

Company Benefits:

  • Remote-first culture and flexible hours
  • Learning resources and annual learning reimbursement
  • Family-friendly policies 
  • Generous vacation policy includes 3 weeks of PTO, 1 week Winter Break, holidays and sick days 
  • Medical, vision and dental insurance coverage
  • 401k
  • Private company stock options
  • Mental health and wellness resources
  • Virtual/in person social events

 

Diversity Statement

At Interplay Learning, diversity and inclusion are fundamental to who we are and how we operate our business. We’re building a diverse workforce that cultivates and supports all individuals for the betterment of each other, our company, and our customers. We believe a culture of equality creates a stronger work environment for all employees and that we are all accountable for encouraging and celebrating diverse voices. Interplay Learning commits to promote and recognize principles of fairness, equity, and social justice in relation to, and across, intersections of race, age, color, disability, faith, religion, ancestry, national origin, citizenship, sex, sexual orientation, social class, economic class, ethnicity, gender identity, gender expression, and all other identities represented among our diverse membership.

We strongly encourage people of color, lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and non-binary people, veterans, and individuals with disabilities to apply. Interplay Learning is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes everyone to our team. Incognia is privately held and headquartered in Palo Alto, California with teams in New York, and São Paulo and Recife, Brazil.

The challenges for this team goes well beyond translation… Culture and attitudes to care will be different, Medication databases will be unique, payroll and invoicing practices will vary, and each country will have it’s own third party integrations. Our salary packages are competitive, this role is £55,000 - £70,000 DOE. We also generous grant stock options to any permanent employee at the end of the probation period. We do adjust salaries based on the cost of living index for employees based outside of the UK.

birdie closes between Christmas and New Year so you can have some down time with your loved ones. This is in addition to your base holiday!

results.title: Senior Product Designer, Merchant Risk Experience
results.description:
Company Description

Since we opened our doors in 2009, the world of commerce has evolved immensely, and so has Square. After enabling anyone to take payments and never miss a sale, we saw sellers stymied by disparate, outmoded products and tools that wouldn’t work together.

To solve this problem, we expanded into software and built integrated solutions to help sellers sell online, manage inventory, book appointments, engage loyal buyers, and hire and pay staff. Across it all, we’ve embedded financial services tools at the point of sale, so merchants can access a business loan and manage their cash flow in one place. Afterpay furthers our goal to provide omnichannel tools that unlock meaningful value and growth, enabling sellers to capture the next generation shopper, increase order sizes, and compete at a larger scale.

Today, we are a partner to sellers of all sizes – large, enterprise-scale businesses with complex operations, sellers just starting, as well as merchants who began selling with Square and have grown larger over time. As our sellers grow, so do our solutions. There is a massive opportunity in front of us. We’re building a significant, meaningful, and lasting business, and we are helping sellers worldwide do the same.

Job Description

The Risk team works to protect the people that trust Square, by minimizing the financial risks that come with running a business. We keep our sellers safe while $25B+ flows through Square annually, and along the way help each other make calculated risk/reward trade offs to grow sellers, and make complicated and sometimes painful processes understandable to all. 

We are looking for a Product Designer to join Risk in delivering critical knowledge and experiences to our sellers that help them make sense of these complex situations in money movement—getting sellers their money faster and protecting them along the way. You will work alongside other product designers, content designers, product managers, researchers, engineering, and legal to increase usability and ease of use across Risk experiences.

  • Design from a customer-first perspective, advocating for the customer and approaching problems with an experience mindset.

You have:

Experience in service design (Systems Design, UX/UI Design, Organizational Design).

Requirements

What You Will Work On

  • Manage day to day operations of customer facing projects including: drafting SOWs with 3rd party partners, monitoring timelines to ensure on-time delivery of work and partnering closely with customer success and sales teams to manage customer expectations.
  • Support client meetings by gathering inputs and compiling data, building presentation decks and assisting with follow up actions
  • Manage and resolve customer questions quickly and effectively via Zendesk
  • Report and escalate issues to necessary internal teams
  • Suggest improvements to training materials and knowledge base when undocumented issues arise
  • Identify systematic issues based on your experience working directly with partners or clients and bring to appropriate cross-functional teams to identify and solve with process improvements

Who You Are:

  • You have 2+ years of customer success or account management experience
  • You are deeply detail oriented and keep a close eye on the fine print
  • You can learn complex technical specifications and requirements and speak eloquently about them.
  • You have an ability to break down ambiguous problems into concrete, manageable components and think through solutions.
  • You are a strong partner and can collaborate with technical teams to drive effective problem resolution.
  • You are an effective communicator and can influence credibly and effectively at all levels
  • While a background in the life sciences is a bonus, it is not a requirement for this role

Benefits

Why Gencove:

  • We are a fast growing team and the product and the company’s needs will change, so your role will also evolve with time — with a sharp eye towards your professional development and personal satisfaction.
  • We are a fully distributed company driven by deliverables, not hours, operating with a foundation of trust and clear communication to solve meaningful scientific and business challenges.
  • We celebrate individuality and invest in bringing everyone together regularly at our HQ in NYC because we believe there is no substitute for real-life connection.
  • Competitive salary and stock options.
  • Flexible PTO plus the days between Christmas and New Year’s Day are company-wide time off; we actually do take time to disconnect, recharge, travel, and live our lives so we encourage you to do the same!
  • 3 months paid parental leave with flexibility to allocate however works best for you.
  • Comprehensive health coverage (medical, dental, vision and life) for you and your family.
  • $1,000 USD home office stipend to upgrade or enhance your work from home setup.

results.title: Customer Care Assistant
results.description:
ABOUT US

MATCHESFASHION started with a single shop in Wimbledon more than 30 years ago and has grown into one of the biggest global destinations in online luxury for men and women, carrying a modern edit of 650+ established and new-generation designers, delivering to over 176 countries. With offices in the UK and Hong Kong, our aspiration is to be the most personal luxury shopping site in the world. In London, our head office is based in The Shard, while our creative hub is in Here East, and 5 Carlos Place, a recently updated retail concept combining digital and physical elements, is based in Mayfair.

 

OUR COMMITMENT TO DEI

We want to attract the very best talent and create an inclusive environment that celebrates the diversity of our people and enables them to do their best work. We recognise the world is not a perfect place and that bias exists, which is why we are committed to ensuring that all our people processes are equitable.

 

THE CUSTOMER CARE TEAM

Customer Care is a dynamic team of talented, customer-focused, resourceful, problem-solving individuals, and we are passionate about all things related to our customers’ experience. Our team is highly collaborative, with our finger on the pulse – ready to solve any problem. In this role not only will you have the pleasure of assisting our customers, you will constantly be learning and find yourself gaining exposure to other facets of the business. We champion our people and provide a dynamic, diverse and supportive workplace. We are a team built on a nonhierarchical environment with great people from diverse backgrounds. Our team embodies the can-do spirit – as well as always innovating, we are continuously driving forward MATCHESFASHION values.

 

 

ROLE: You probably know how this story goes…

A customer calls. Her name is Alison, she is calling from New York about an issue with her MATCHESFASHION order. In her previous experience with other brands these phone calls are time-consuming and unhelpful, so she is already preparing herself for an irritating conversation. Except that Customer Care means something different at MATCHESFASHION and it’s YOU that picked up her call. You are curious and keen to find out how you can help her, and you have the expertise to solve her problem (expertise which we help you refine with our comprehensive training as well as learning & development opportunities). You are polite and proactive; in the end she lowers her guard and opens up. Her order is something she needs for an event that may change her career. Whilst you find out what has happened with her order you realise you share a common interest in art galleries and travel, she suggests her favorite rooftop bar for you to visit if you are ever in New York. In the meantime, you have solved the problem. She is so grateful; you made her day! You wish her luck and close the call.

And just like that you have shown her that luxury at MATCHESFASHION is more than the content of the parcel she will receive soon (thanks to you!). It is in the expertise, generosity of spirit and in the connection created by its people.

Since our first MATCHESFASHION shop in Wimbledon over 30 years ago, providing a meaningful and personal luxury experience for our customers has been at the heart of what we do. Now are one of the biggest global destinations in online luxury for men and women, with a modern edit of over 450 established and new generation designers, delivering to over 176 countries. Famous for our fashion point of view, with a forward-looking focus on innovation and emerging talent, what remains the same as we grow is our focus on customers experience.

Everyday our Customer Care team connect and support our customers via phone, email, chat and social working collaboratively across the business and team to solve problems, help customers to place orders, making the right decisions and taking accountability for every single customers MATCHESFASHION journey. As our business grows so does our team. We are looking for people like you to come and help us create these experiences for each one of our customers every day. We like to consider ourselves a “one stop shop”. When you’re the person that our lucky customer connects with, you’ll be able to give them a concierge style service whatever their enquiry.

If you have experience in fast paced customer facing environments, are eager to learn and in search of an opportunity to distinguish yourself for your outstanding customer care talent in a leading luxury shopping destination you have come to the right place.

 

ABOUT YOU:

  • Love to solve a problem and take responsibility
  • Are resilient with the tenacity to not give up until the problem is solved
  • Have experience fast paced customer facing environments
  • Enjoy getting stuck in and working with your team and with business partners to find the right solution
  • Have fluent English both written and spoken
  • Know your way around Microsoft Office
  • Are able to work flexible shift patterns including evenings, weekends and bank holidays
  • Are keen to learn more about the luxury fashion industry and the exciting brands that we stock on MATCHESFASHION
  • This role is remote working and not office based.

 

BENEFITS

  • 50% employee discount
  • Hybrid working, with option to work across three locations – The Shard, Here East and Carlos Place (role dependent)
  • Breakfast provided at The Shard and Here East locations
  • 33 days holiday (including bank holidays), and the option to buy up to 5 additional days
  • Extra day off for your birthday
  • Access to Health Cash Plan including dental, glasses and contact lenses, physiotherapy and more.

Please Note: This role is fully remote, and we are open to candidates based all over the UK. This role is full time (37.5 hours) however part time hours are available. Shifts will be issued on a rota basis and consist of evenings and weekends. We would also welcome someone who is looking for evening only or night shifts.

Further details of hours available can be discussed at interview stage

results.title: Copywriter
results.description:
Position Summary

The person who fulfills the Copywriter role will bring a powerful combination of both big-picture, strategic thinking, and tactics-focused abilities. They will write short- and long-form copy for a wide range of deliverables. They will clearly communicate complex healthcare topics in a user-friendly, digestible way.

 

Key Areas of Responsibility

  • Interpret creative briefs and client needs — and ask helpful questions to fill any gaps necessary to complete assignments.
  • Ideate, execute, a speak convincingly of conceptual ideas.
  • Write clear, compelling, persuasive copy for email campaigns, websites, newsletters, brochures, social ads, video scripts, and other copywriting deliverables.
  • Adapt to different industries and audiences.
  • Adapt to each client’s tone, style, and voice guidelines.
  • The ability to develop persuasive messaging around business and marketing objectives.
  • Revise content based on internal and client feedback.
  • Ensure copywriting deliverables and internal documents are in tip-top shape from a spelling, punctuation, and grammar perspective.
  • Collaborate with our editorial, account management, project management, client engagement, and design teams.

Requirements

  • 3-5 years of copywriting experience, preferably in a creative setting (agency, in-house creative team, etc.).
  • Bachelor’s degree in journalism, marketing, or related field.
  • A portfolio that demonstrates exciting work that features a range of conceptual and tactical writing.
  • Experience writing for healthcare or other technical/regulated industries is a plus.
  • Aligns with our values: People, Commitment, Aspiration, Trustworthiness & Impact.
  • Demonstrates these Brado skills: Agile, Bold, Innovative, Curious, Empathetic, Teamwork, Self-starter, Verbal & Written Communication, Creative Thinking.
  • Demonstrates these role-specific skills:
    • Excellent research skills and the ability to interpret and clearly communicate complex concepts.
    • A strong grasp of A.P. style guidelines and the ability to proofread and edit copy for grammar, accuracy, clarity, flow, voice, and actionability.
    • Impeccable time-management skills and respect for deadlines.
    • The ability to receive and act on constructive criticism.
    • A proven track record of improving copy based on internal and client feedback.
    • The professionalism to present work internally.
  • Adhere with all Brado and client required training and guidelines for market research and healthcare industry regulations and laws. Specifically (but not limited to) Pharmacovigilance (PV) and Healthcare Providers (HCPs) processes and reporting, Ethics, Confidentiality, Data Privacy / Security and Harassment.

Benefits

  • Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)
  • Retirement Plan (401k, IRA)
  • Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D)
  • Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
  • Family Leave (Maternity, Paternity)
  • Short Term & Long Term Disability
  • Training & Development
  • Work From Home

results.title: Head of Data Operations
results.description:
Head of Data Operations

Viridios AI is at the forefront of solutions for the climate and sustainability markets. We have developed AI-based fair valuation and risk management models that solves a major problem in value transparency and is quickly becoming the market reference for fair prices of carbon credits (offsets), from forestry and agriculture to renewable energy and energy efficiency activities worldwide. Our company and product have recently been recognized as Best Market Innovation by Environmental Finance, one of the major publications in the fast growing carbon markets space.

There is much to do when it comes to applying technology in doing right by the planet and its inhabitants, and we are always looking for highly talented individuals to join us in this journey.

We are now recruiting for a Head of Data Operations to join a highly qualified team with domain expertise and years of experience in markets and technology. The typical candidate works with a major market data provider, a bank or an asset manager dealing with market data in various asset classes (equities, fixed income, commodities, etc) as well as various other datasets such as reference data, etc. This is your opportunity to grow into and contribute to some of the most prominent and important themes of our age: climate, sustainability and technology.

  • This is a permanent position
  • You will report to the CEO
  • Candidates based in the UK or Continental Europe
  • You will be working remote

What We Offer

  • Competitive base compensation
  • Annual cash bonus
  • Employee stock allocated upfront with tremendous upside
  • A vibrant and creative work environment
  • Exposure to one of the most exciting sectors today

Responsibilities

  • Lead the data operations team (5 currently, 8 budgeted) comprising of market data and carbon project data operations
  • Maintain and build all data sourcing, validation and publication processes
  • Ensure that all data operations delivery processes are fully operational and reliable
  • Expand data sourcing operations in the carbon markets through the establishment of new commercial relationships with partners
  • Represent the company at events and conferences
  • Contribute to the company's credibility through thought leadership on carbon markets data
  • Contribute to regular publication of newsletters on carbon markets
  • Perform daily market data and weekly carbon project data publication sign off
  • Work closely with market data team on daily data preparation, validation and calibration for Golden Source data warehouse
  • Work closely with carbon project data team on weekly data preparation, validation and calibration for Golden Source data warehouse
  • Monitor and maintain the integrity and validity of the data being sourced, processed and published
  • Work alongside the data science team on datasets preparation to be used in model development
  • Work closely with market data team on maintaining and calibrating model data inputs and parameters
  • Lead the designing, building and maintenance of reports and data dashboards used to derive insights from data
  • Validate and support data models, data-mining methodologies, and reporting of metrics to stakeholders

Required

  • Bachelor's degree in business, finance or in a technical area (e.g., computer science, engineering, physics, mathematics, etc)
  • Deep understanding and hands-on experience with data operations in financial markets (market data, reference data, etc)
  • Experience working with data products and financial data platforms (Bloomberg, ICE, etc)
  • Professional experience in financial markets with banks, asset managers, market data providers and platforms, etc
  • Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills
  • Strong time and project management skills
  • Fast learner, capable of quickly gaining domain expertise in the highly complex climate and sustainability markets
  • Clear analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to envision and propose new and creative ways to solutions
  • Passion for technology and data, and issues related to climate and sustainability markets
  • Ability to work well with teams in a collaborative way
  • Exceptional business and technical communication in English, verbal and written
  • Proficiency in Excel and other data business tools

Desired

  • Ability to run Python code (not necessarily build Python software)
  • Ability to run in SQL and NoSQL (Mongo) queries

results.title: Senior Growth Marketing Manager
results.description:
Are you interested in the next generation of Artificial Intelligence and Natural Language Processing? Then, read on. Level AI is on a mission to redefine the customer service industry by putting the latest AI/ML advances in the hands of customer care agents so they can solve any customer issues at record speed, creating both happier customers and agents. 
Join us in our quest to equip call centers with cutting-edge technologies so that they can put the human back into the customer care experience.
Level AI (https://thelevel.ai/) is a hyper-growth, series B, Silicon Valley-based startup backed by Battery Ventures. We’ve assembled a seasoned team with leaders from organizations such as Amazon Alexa, Facebook, Google, Figma, Freshworks, and Medallia, among others.
 
The Role
We are seeking a high-performing B2B marketer with a passion for building new categories and partnering with sales teams to accelerate revenue growth. As the Growth Marketing Manager, you will drive and optimize all growth metrics from top to bottom of the funnel and in-product growth initiatives.
 
 In this role, you will drive growth marketing campaigns all the way from strategy to launch and scale. This includes defining the strategy, mobilizing creative agencies, designing a testing plan, executing the campaigns, analyzing results to track campaign success, and optimizing. You will become a thought leader on multi-channel acquisition campaigns to meet our sales pipeline goals. You are a strategic and analytical thinker who can break down problems and find solutions. You are a collaborator who thrives in a highly cross-functional environment.
The ideal candidate is passionate about their career and pushing Level AI to exceed our business goals. This person is also innately curious about business, technology, and new approaches to B2B revenue growth.
 
Responsibilities:
 
• Partner with sales to create campaigns that drive new sales pipeline and develop a world-class Account Based Marketing strategy. Leveraging key channels such as digital advertising, web marketing, video, webinars, direct mail, events, field activities, and more.
• Understand the persona we are targeting on an intimate level. Understand the channels and offers that will get that persona to convert
• Set metrics goals for the marketing team and continually optimize with a passion for creative testing
• Inspire our optimistic, hardworking team to build the industry’s best performance marketing engine.
• Develop content and creativity to support acquisition programs.
Skills
• An analytical thinker with operational prowess who loves digging into the numbers.
• An empathetic and curious individual who brings a strong point of view and collaborative mindset.
• 3+ years in growth marketing roles 
• Experience  in all traditional marketing tactics and motions (press releases, analyst relations, events, webinars, user groups, SEO, social media, ad campaigns, content syndication etc)
• A minimum of 3 years hands-on experience in Demand Generation driving B2B marketing activities with lengthy sales cycles
• Agency or freelance/consulting experience a huge +
• Strong problem-solving and analysis skills, along with solid business acumen.
• Demonstrated capacity to manage multiple complex marketing programs at once.
• Ability to work across all functions including marketing, product, business development, pre-sales, and post-sales
• Bachelor's degree in business or technology field; Computer Science or Engineering degree is a plus
• This is a remote position
• Occasional travel is required
